titlestmt.titleproper: Register to The David Stanley Smith Papers
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Adrienne Nesnow

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 00:11

did.abstract: Music, correspondence and other papers, photographs, and additional materials by and about the American composer, conductor, and educator David Stanley Smith (1877-1949)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Papers are open to researchers by appointment. There are no restricted materials in the collection. Please contact the Special Collections staff to schedule an appointment.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The David Stanley Smith Papers were established in the Music Library of Yale University by Cora Welch Smith in 1950. Miscellaneous additional material was given to the Library in 1977 by Smith's son, Christopher S. Smith.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The David Stanley Smith Papers are the physical property of the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University. Copyrights belong to the composers and authors, or their legal heirs and assigns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: MSS 31, The David Stanley Smith Papers in the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: In 8 series as follows: I. Music. II. Correspondence. III. Clippings. IV. Programs. V. Photographs. VI. Works by and about David Stanley Smith. VII. Royalty statements and agreements. VIII. Memorabilia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The David Stanley Smith Papers include sketches, manuscript scores, and printed editions of Smith's musical compositions, including orchestral music, keyboard works, chamber pieces, songs, and choral music. Smith's life and work are also documented by: correspondence; programs; photographs; clippings and biographical materials; and miscellaneous items.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Stanley Smith was born in Toledo, Ohio, on July 6, 1877. He grew up in a musical household, and by the age of fifteen he had found employment as a church organist. In 1895 he went to Yale, where Charles Ives (Class of 1898) was numbered among his friends; he would later serve as the organist at Center Church in New Haven, a position formerly held by Ives. Smith was an outstanding student, and he became the protégé of Professor Horatio Parker. Smith's graduation ceremony in 1900 featured a performance of his Ode for Commencement Day, conducted by Parker. After college, Smith traveled throughout Europe, where he took lessons with Ludwig Thuille and Charles-Marie Widor.

In 1903 Smith returned to Yale as an instructor in music theory. He would remain a member the Yale faculty until his retirement in 1946. Horatio Parker died in 1919, and the next year Smith succeeded him as Dean of the School of Music, a post he would hold until 1940. Again following in Parker's footsteps, he also became the conductor of the New Haven Symphony Orchestra.

Despite his duties as a teacher, administrator, and conductor, Smith was able to compose a substantial amount of music, including one opera, Merrymount, five symphonies, ten string quartets, many sacred works, and a variety of other compositions.
Smith married Cora Deming Welch in 1913. They had one son, Christopher Stanley Smith.
David Stanley Smith died in New Haven on December 17, 1949.

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series is divided into nine subseries (A-J) by genre. Cross-references have been made from parts of works to the title under which they are described. Transcription of the title page is given only when it contains information not stated in the uniform title. Many of the published works were previously catalogued, and any cards containing extra information have been laid in with their respective works. The term "bis," which occurs occasionally beside an opus number in a uniform title, is taken from the old cataloging where it was used to distinguish items with the same opus number. Subseries A-H are arranged alphabetically by title. The subseries J (Miscellaneous works) is divided into: Cadenzas, piano; Exercises; Juvenilia; Lists; Sketches; and Works by Others, with the works arranged alphabetically by title under these broad headings.

odd.p: Lists of compositions of David Stanley Smith.

Several lists, both manuscript and typescript, including a spiral notebook with list prepared by his wife, Cora W. Smith. These include opus numbers, publishers, dates of publication, and dates, performers, and places of performances.

did.physdesc: 1 notebook + approx. 186 p. of loose and variously grouped sheets ; various sizes.

did.unittitle: Lists of music by others from David Stanley Smith's library
List of music by others from David Stanley Smith's library found with this collection in 1981.

did.physdesc: Loose sheets ([30] p. of music) various sizes.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Contents: Blessed are they that hunger and thirst after righteousness -- Concerto -- The delicate air (1940 Jul 2) -- Organ finale -- Piano piece -- Russian carols -- Violin sonata -- Unidentified sketches.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous unidentified sketches, pieces, and fragments of pieces.

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series is divided into letters to and from Smith and others. It is arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

did.unittitle: To David Stanley Smith or Mrs. Smith from others

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes letters from Nadia Boulanger, Carl Engel, Ossip Gabrilowitsch, Howard Hanson, Arthur Shepherd, Bruce Simonds, Ralph Vaughan Williams, and Bruno Walter as well as from others.

did.unittitle: Society for the Publication of American Music
From David Stanley Smith to others
Letters from David Stanley Smith and others to H. Earle Johnson

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series contains newspaper and magazine clippings concerning Smith, others, and miscellaneous subjects. They are arranged chronologically within each subseries. If a clipping was found with an item such as a letter, a note has been added to the clipping and the item. The clippings have been photocopied onto acid-free paper.

did.unittitle: Concerning David Stanley Smith and His Music

odd.head: General
odd.p: Programs concerning performances by David Stanley Smith or of his works, as well as those concerning works or performances by others.

did.unittitle: Photographs of David Stanley Smith and others
Works by and about David Stanley Smith

odd.head: General
odd.p: This series contains works by Smith, such as articles and lecture notes, and biographical material. The items are arranged chronologically within each subseries.
